gold_answer: A semi-character based RNN (ScRNN) treats the first and last characters individually, and is agnostic to the ordering of the internal charactersprocesses a sentence of words with misspelled characters, predicting the correct words at each step
predict: A semicharacter architecture is an architectural variant where the system can be modularized but relies on human-made rules to allow its independence from specific languages. It allows for easier application of the same architecture to different languages by changing modules or models in existing tools.
reasoning: Answer A describes a specific type of semicharacter architecture focused on a semi-character based RNN that processes sentences with misspelled characters. Answer B, on the other hand, provides a broader definition of semicharacter architecture as a modular system that relies on human-made rules for language independence. While both answers relate to semicharacter architecture, they focus on different aspects and applications, making them not semantically equivalent.
